title: Inside Strictly Come Dancing star Michelle Visage's Californian home
text:
Advertisement

She's been showing off her skilled footwork alongside Italian choreographer Giovanni Pernice on this year's edition of Strictly Come Dancing.

And Michelle Visage has treated fans to a glimpse of where she kicks her feet up following busy days at work in a series of Instagram snaps.

The RuPaul's Drag Race judge, 51 - who shares her comfy Californian home with husband David Case and their daughters Lillie, 19, and Lola, 17 - has appeared to inject her signature glamour into her abode - which is complete with a fancy vanity area, sleek interiors and cosy furniture for her pet pooches Romeo and Daisy.

Inside her home: Michelle Visage has treated fans to a glimpse of where she kicks her feet up following busy days at work in a series of Instagram snaps

Known for dressing up to the nines, it comes as no surprise that the former Seduction singer's massive vanity room features wig stands, striking heels and a series of wooden cabinets.

The Celebrity Big Brother star's positive persona is displayed in her living room, as the wide space is decorated with bedazzled block letters which read 'JOY', teamed with a modern wooden fire place and floral patterned seating.

A self-professed dog lover, Michelle has designed her home with her pets in mind as it boasts a selection of padded furniture, rounded off with removable cushions.

The reality star's sitting room also features floor-to-ceiling windows for a clear view of outdoors, while her grass-covered garden includes plenty of space for her animals to run around.

Glitz and glam: The RuPaul's Drag Race judge, 51, has appeared to inject her signature style into her abode - which is complete with a fancy vanity area, sleek interiors and cosy furniture for her pet pooches Romeo and Daisy

Sneak peek: Known for dressing up to the nines, it comes as no surprise that the former Seduction singer's massive vanity room features wig stands, striking heels and a series of wooden cabinets

Lap of luxury: The CBB star's positive persona is displayed in her living room, as the wide space is decorated with bedazzled block letters which read 'JOY', teamed with a modern wooden fire place and floral patterned seating (pictured: dog Romeo)

Michelle's quaint kitchen is fitted with a traditional gas cooker, cream cabinets and a fridge covered in personal snaps to complement the property's homely feel.

Earlier this month, Michelle revealed she 'held out' for Strictly Come Dancing and even turned down other shows such as Dancing With The Stars to appear on the programme.

The television personality also said 'it's time' for same-sex couples to appear on the series. Discussing her dance stint, the brunette told MailOnline and other press: 'I love this country so much, I feel like Strictly holds more of the traditionalism that the dances are. I don't want to go crazy and do wacky stuff.

'I like the idea of if you give me a waltz, I'm going to do a waltz... I don't have to break into the running man to make it interesting, I want to do a beautiful waltz.

Full relaxation mode: A self-professed dog lover, Michelle has designed her home with her pets in mind as it boasts a selection of padded furniture, rounded off with removable cushions

Views: The reality star's sitting room also features floor-to-ceiling windows for a clear view of outdoors, while her grass-covered garden features plenty of space for her animals to run around

Time to cook: Michelle's quaint kitchen is fitted with a traditional gas cooker, cream cabinets and a fridge covered in personal snaps to complement the property's homely feel

Family first: The TV star shares her home with husband David Case and their daughters Lillie (far left), 19, and Lola (far right), 17

'That’s what I love about Strictly, over Dancing With The Stars, or any of the other shows, is that they can keep the traditions of all of them alive, that's why I held out for this one.'

Talking about having same-sex couples on Strictly, after years of campaigning by show fans, Michelle added: 'I mean, I feel like it's time, you know, it’s definitely been time for that to happen. So I think if anyone's going to do it, Strictly will do it and they will do it right. I think it’s time, for sure!'

'I don’t think gender really has a place in there anymore, I think if it looks good, it looks good, if it doesn’t, then you just deal with it.'

The radio DJ has cemented a successful career for herself as a judge on the DragRace franchise and on the judging panel of Ireland's Got Talent.

Yet the TV star isn't concerned about being judged on Strictly and has actually admitted that it is 'fantastic' being critiqued by experts.
description: The RuPaul's Drag Race judge, 51, has treated fans to a glimpse of where she kicks her feet up following busy days at work in California in a series of Instagram snaps.
